name: ListUserGrants
description:
Retrieve all grants for a specific user in Okta.

Use this tool to list all the grants assigned to a specified user in the Okta system. It's useful for understanding user permissions and access levels.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of an existing Okta user for whom to list grants.

value_schema.description: ID of an existing Okta user

parameters.name: scope_id_filter
parameters.description: The scope ID used to filter user grants.

value_schema.description: The scope ID to filter on

parameters.name: include_scope_details
parameters.description: Include scope details in the response using the `_embedded` attribute. Use `scope` as the value.

value_schema.description: Valid value: `scope`. If specified, scope details are included in the `_embedded` attribute.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor string for pagination, obtained from the `Link` header to track the current position in the list.

value_schema.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It is an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: grant_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of grants to return for a user. Use an integer value to determine how many results you want to retrieve.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of grants to return

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the okta API.

parameters.name: scopeId
parameters.description: The scope ID to filter on

value_schema.description: The scope ID to filter on

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Valid value: `scope`. If specified, scope details are included in the `_embedded` attribute.

value_schema.description: Valid value: `scope`. If specified, scope details are included in the `_embedded` attribute.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It is an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

value_schema.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It is an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of grants to return

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of grants to return

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of an existing Okta user

value_schema.description: ID of an existing Okta user

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
